intro: Palicourea nicotianifolia, commonly known as the tobacco leaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or humid environments. Palicourea nicotianifolia is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
